intro: Croton leprosus, commonly known as the Leprous Croton, is a species of flowering plant in the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly East Africa, and thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its striking, often colorful leaves that vary in shape and texture. It produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, followed by unique, spiky fruits. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated as a decorative plant in subtropical gardens.
